summary: We and others have found that at large financial institutions, management weaknesses—such as ineffective leadership by boards of directors, and compensation tied to quantity of rather than quality of loans—contributed to the 2007-2009 financial crisis. Are federal banking regulators addressing these weaknesses? We found regulators have improved their supervision of large banks’ management activities and generally followed leading practices. However, regulators could do a better...
title: Bank Supervision: Regulators Improved Supervision of Management Activities but Additional Steps Needed
